metadata.feature_description: Post wiki activities to user and group activity journals

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify wiki article journal entry appears in Activity Feed

steps.action: Login as SuperUser and navigate to the Activity Feed page
steps.expected: Activity Feed page loads showing user's activity stream
steps.actual: Activity Feed page loaded successfully showing SuperUser Account profile and activity stream with various posts

steps.action: Navigate to Wiki Test page to confirm wiki articles exist
steps.actual: Wiki Test page displays 6 articles including Test Article Draft, Test Article for Tagging, Test Article for Search, Test Article for Bookmarks, Test Article for Revision Management

steps.action: Navigate to Activity Feed and scroll to find wiki journal entries
steps.expected: Wiki article creation activities should appear in the Activity Feed
steps.actual: Found wiki journal entry: 'Anonymous authored wiki article Test Article Draft' with article summary 'This is a test article to verify the article creation functionality in the Wiki module. It contains sample content for testing purposes.'

steps.action: Verify wiki journal entry has proper actions (Like, Read More, Comment)
steps.expected: Journal entry should have interaction options
steps.actual: Journal entry displays Like, Read More (linking to article), Comment, and Remove options

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test Activity Feed filter for wiki entries

steps.action: Use the Activity Feed filter dropdown to select 'Added to Wiki'
steps.expected: Feed should filter to show only wiki article creation entries
steps.actual: Filter applied successfully, showing 6 wiki article journal entries (Test Article Draft, Test Article for Tagging, Test Article for Search, Test Article for Bookmarks, Test Article for Revision Management, Test Article for Metadata)

steps.action: Verify filter dropdown includes wiki-related options
steps.expected: Dropdown should have 'Added to Wiki' and 'Updated Wiki' options
steps.actual: Filter dropdown includes both 'Added to Wiki' and 'Updated Wiki' options among other activity types

observations: Code analysis confirms Journal.cs handles wiki journal integration with AddWikiToJournal and RemoveWikiFromJournal methods
Journal entries are created when articles are published (not for drafts) via ArticleController.cs line 257
Journal entries are removed when articles are deleted via ArticleController.cs line 303
The journal type name is 'Wiki_AddArticle' as defined in Constants.JournalWikiAddName
Journal entries include article title, summary, and a link to the article details page
Group journal entries are supported - when an article has a GroupId > 0, the SocialGroupId is set on the journal item
